comment.author: 28304000@N00
comment._content: Anyone have any ideas where exactly this was located?  The captions refer to George St and Macquarie St.  But these street don't go to where the present Cumberland Hosptial is which owes it's origins to this establishment...

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: I thought it was on the north side near the jail.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/entity.aspx?path=\agency\1997 Well this website says it actually was at George Street, and that the building was originally built in 1824. I always thought it was on the north side, but there isn't any George Street on the north side. I really should figure this out, my greatgreat grandfather died there. I don't think this establishment was located at Cumberland Hospital, why do you think this ?

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: I cant make much sense of this thread archiver.rootsweb.ancestry.com/th/read/AUS-PT-JACKSON-CON... but I get the impression that the George Street Asylum was approximately at the vicinity of where the Workers Club is now.
